Description: The engineer responsible for managing and coordinating the project, acting as the main point of contact.
The year in which the project was initiated, awarded, or officially recorded.
Unique identifier for the customer’s purchase order
The client or company who placed the order.
Name or reference of the overall project that the order belongs to.
The specific equipment, heater, control panel, or vessel
Factory or supplier responsible for manufacturing the equipment. (USA, Spain, China)
The delivery condition specified in the purchase order (e.g., EXW, FOB, CIF).
The total quantity of items ordered.
Total monetary value of the purchase order or project scope.
Maximum Liquidated Damages rate allowed in the contract (e.g., 1% per week).
Assessment of potential LD exposure (No/Yes) based on schedule and complexity.
The maximum total LD penalty amount that can be charged by the customer.
Any additional cost beyond the original order (e.g., due to design change, material upgrade).
Reference number or description of additional scope or modifications requested by the customer.
Monetary value associated with the change order.
The date the purchase order was issued by the customer.
Committed delivery date specified in the purchase order.
The real shipment date when the product left the factory.
Invoice amount of the project value that received payment.
Short description of the project progress stage (e.g., Completed,Fabrication,Final Document,Final inspection,Prepare document,Procurement,Shipping).
Overall project condition (e.g., Shipped, Delayed, On track).
Percentage or qualitative measure indicating completion stage of the project.
The year in which the project was initiated, awarded, or officially recorded.
Sequential running number used for indexing or organizing invoice
The engineer responsible for managing and coordinating the project, acting as the main point of contact.
Unique identifier for the customer’s purchase order
The client or company who placed the order.
The total contract value or total sale order value before breaking down into invoices or milestones.
The percentage of the total contract value assigned to each invoice or payment milestone.
Actual amount of the invoice issued, calculated based on percentage or milestone.
The currency in which the invoice value is issued (e.g., THB, USD, EUR).
The planned date for issuing the invoice according to project or contract schedule.
The actual date the invoice was officially issued to the customer.
The deadline by which the customer is expected to make the payment.
The planned date when payment is expected to be received based on contract terms.
Forecasted date of customer payment, updated based on latest information.
The actual date payment from the customer was received and recorded.
Number of days payment was received later than the due date or expected payment date.
Actual amount of the invoice received
The current payment condition (e.g., Paid, Invoiced, Not Invoiced, Aging).
